title: Help me name my e-zine (contest)
content:
I am planning to do a type & graphic design e-newsletter, distributed by e-mail to subscribers.  
The content will be :

- type tips and tricks
- tidbits from the type & design world
- updates and new releases of Alphabet Design fonts

I already have an e-newsletter called _alfaBITS_ geared towards the general business audience with tips on marketing, managing, etc.

The winning entry will receive a collection of Alphabet Design fonts worth $100. Two runners-up will each receive a single font.

Please visit [www.alphabet-design.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080908090640/http:/www.alphabet-design.com/ "www.alphabet-design.com")

Thanks!

 [‹ Who, if anyone, do you use for printing?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080908090640/http:/www.typophile.com/node/13221 "Go to previous forum topic") [Type Battle Exhibition at TypeCon 2006 ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080908090640/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20704 "Go to next forum topic")
author: alfabet

shrift  
Pronunciation: (shrift), [key]  
—n. Archaic.  
1. the imposition of penance by a priest on a penitent after confession.  
2. absolution or remission of sins granted after confession and penance.  
3. confession to a priest.

Hmm, the last two postings look very similar to [Coudal’s Booking Bands contest](http://web.archive.org/)—

which is a great source of wordplay inspiration in itself.

To clarify, this is going to be an electronic publication, an e-newsletter, some prefer the term e-zine.

You can certainly get a subscription to it by visiting my fonts pages at [www.alphabet-design.com/FONTS/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080908090640/http:/www.alphabet-design.com/FONTS/ "www.alphabet-design.com/FONTS/") and pick up a free font while you’re at it.

Since the name of the studio is Alphabet Design, ideally the name of the e-zine would be evocative of the studio name.

So something like

- alfaTYPES
- alfabet4T
- typeA
- typeAlfa
- Case:alfa
- AlfaCase

Current favourites (in no particular order):

- Dingbet
- AlfaLetter
- TypeEzine.com
- AlfaCase
- AlfaTIPS (but maybe too similar to alfaBITS)
- Case & Point (would be OK to use since I’m not running a law firm) 
- Alfa2Zed
- Open Counter
- Type Points 
- Stealing Sheep 
- TypeWriter 

For a general business audience I am publishing an e-newsletter called _alfaBITS_.  
To get a sample of _alfaBITS_ at [www.alphabet-design.com/alfabits/sample.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080908090640/http:/www.alphabet-design.com/alfabits/sample.html "www.alphabet-design.com/alfabits/sample.html")

Thanks!

Boris
I like alphaTIPS myself. Works well with alphaBits and the “Alpha” is more inclined to designer folk.

I don’t really understand the replacement of ph with f, makes Alfatips seem like a magazine of advice for Alfa Romeo owners (and if you’ve ever owned one you will need advice:)
